creator: Syretia
text:
- Portable, self-contained, universal package type for Linux. - To use an AppImage, just download it, make it executable (either through your file manager or using chmod +x), and run it. - No install required. - No package manager required. - Include all dependencies needed to run the target program that would not be found on the average Linux system. - Not sandboxed, but are completely self-contained. - Some AppImages can update themselves (but won't do so without telling the user). - [appimagehub](https://appimage.github.io/apps/) is the official listing of available AppImages. ***If you are on Ubuntu 22.04 or newer, you will need to install libfuse2 (`sudo apt install libfuse2`) before you can use AppImages.***
*This entry needs to be expanded with more information about AppImages.*
title: appimages
caption: AppImages
